basic.description: An introduction to 3d visualization of natural sciences data with a focus on methods relevant to geological engineering, mineral exploration, and geoscience research. Perception, representation, and analytical methods. Design tools and data integration methods. Temporal analysis of natural sciences data. LiDAR data analysis. Global and local models. Virtual worlds. (1.5 credit units). PREREQUISITE: GEOL/GEOE463 or GEOL 855 or Permission of the instructor
basic.subject: GEOL
basic.title: Visualization in the Geosciences
